Growth on Defined Medium with glycerol-containing minimal medium in the presence of 1 uM of hydoxyphenylpropionic acid (HPP). mhp operon is regulated positively by MhpR and its binding is required for CRP binding and catabolic repression in presence of glucose.
The activity was three fold more in succinate respect to glucose reflecting catabolite repression, but the addition of tyramine to succinate results in an increment of 13 times for tynA expression.
This gene is subject to catabolite repression and is transcribed at high basal level. The effect of catabolite repression on the regulated genes by FeaR could be mediated by this regulator.

Growth in minimal medium M63 supplemented, the induction was observed with the adition of fucose to the medium. GalS acts as a repressor of its own synthesis and GalR repress to galS in a noninducible manner
Defined mediumGalR was not induced with supplement of fucose or galactose, galR was constituve, the B-gal activity was 5-10 fold higher than galS suggesting that the galR promoter is stronger.

ampC is no more induced on later phases of growth
